meanings.definition: To purchase more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outbuys her friends when they go shopping together.
meanings.sent2: He outbuys his siblings when it comes to buying snacks.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outbuys her big brother with her allowance money.
meanings.sent4: In the game of Monopoly, she outbuys all her opponents to win.
meanings.sent5: The competitive shopper outbuys everyone in the store with her quick decisions.

meanings.definition: To buy something at a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outbuys his neighbors by finding the best deals in town.
meanings.sent2: She always outbuys her friends by shopping during sales.
meanings.sent3: The thrifty shopper outbuys everyone by using coupons wisely.
meanings.sent4: In the auction, he outbuys the other bidders with his strategic bidding.
meanings.sent5: The smart shopper outbuys everyone by waiting for discounts before purchasing.

meanings.definition: To acquire goods or services by paying more than others.
meanings.sent1: She outbuys her classmates by offering a higher price for the rare book.
meanings.sent2: He outbuys his colleagues by paying extra for faster delivery.
meanings.sent3: The determined buyer outbuys everyone by bidding aggressively in the auction.
meanings.sent4: In the negotiation, she outbuys the competitors by offering a better deal.
meanings.sent5: The wealthy businessman outbuys everyone by outbidding them in the auction.
